document_data.name: Criosphinx
document_data.mainbody: '''Criosphinxes''' ({{Pronounce|KRY|o|sfinks|refs = {{Cite dragon/93/Ay pronunseeAYshun gyd|25}}}}) were a type of ram-headed [[sphinx]].
document_data.Description: Like other types of sphinx, these creatures had tawny [[lion]] bodies as large as a [[horse]] with large wings similar to that of a [[falcon]]. In addition, they were always male.{{Cite dragon/244/The Ecology of the Sphinx|86}}
document_data.Personality: Criosphinxes found wealth extremely attractive and would pursue it above all else if they couldn't find a [[gynosphinx]]. Because of their penchant for wealth, they enjoyed extorting tolls from travelers. They also had remarkable memories, at least in terms of remembering their treasure caches.
document_data.Combat: Unlike other types of sphinxes, these creatures did not possess an innate spellcasting ability. Because of this, they relied upon their leonine claws and ram-horns in combat, and would forgo using their teeth. When fighting, their combat tactics were rather simple.

Society.Diet: These creatures were a carnivorous species. They would use their sharp teeth to rip chunks of meat from their prey and then swallow them whole.
Society.Habitats:
Criosphinxes were typically found in deserts{{Cite dragon/244/The Ecology of the Sphinx|84}}

In [[Faer√ªn]], they could be found in the [[Hullack Forest]]. In the [[Shining South]] they could be found in [[Dambrath]], [[the Shaar]], and the [[Toadsquat Mountains]].
Society.Languages: These creatures were capable of speaking [[Common]], as well as the language of sphinxes and animals.
Society.Relationships:
Criosphinxes were known to act as [[favored animal|servants]] of the deity [[Nephthys]].{{Cite web enhancement/Deity Do's and Don'ts|13}}

Criosphinxes lusted after gynosphinxes and constantly sought them out, though the latter found them repulsive.

document_data.History: Around [[1374 DR]], one could find criosphinxes stabled by the [[Zhentarim]] as [[mount]]s within the [[Temple in the Sky]].<ref>
